means: （汽车）连箱的（拥有较长的车身和后门，后座后面有较大的空间）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"财产，财富"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: wealth, assets, estate, goods, property, resources
means: wealth ： 普通用词，含义广。既可指大笔的钱财或物质财富，也可指抽象的精神财富。
assets ： 法律和商业用词，指包括全部动产和不动产的资产。
estate ： 多指地产或建在地面上的房产。
goods ： 含义较窄，主要指个人动产。
property含义较estate宽，指个人或团体合法拥有的财产，包括动产与不动产，或临时的财产。
resources ： 指在需要时可以动用的财产，包括国家土地、矿藏、水力等自然资源或个人的存款及其他财产。

sentence.Network_en: By his own admission, he evaded taxes as a Florida real-estate speculator.
sentence.Network_cn: 他亲口承认自己在佛罗里达从事房地产投机生意时逃过税。

sentence.Network_en: The allowable deduction is apportioned between the estate and the beneficiaries.
sentence.Network_cn: 减免的税额在地产和受益人之间分摊。

sentence.Network_en: We went straight to the estate agent and wrote out a cheque.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们径直到房地产经纪人那里开了一张支票。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'state or condition'): from Old French estat, from Latin status 'state, condition', from stare 'to stand'

entry.tran: 庄园;地产；（在乡村的）大片私有土地
entry.def: An estate is a large area of land in the country which is owned by a person, family, or organization.

example.ex: ...a shooting party on Lord Wyville's estate in Yorkshire.
example.tran: 在怀维尔勋爵位于约克郡的庄园里举行的狩猎会

entry.def: People sometimes use estate to refer to a housing estate or an industrial estate.

example.ex: He used to live on the estate.
example.tran: 他过去曾住在那个住宅区。

entry.def: Someone's estate is all the money and property that they leave behind them when they die.

example.tran: 他的遗产被估价为15万美元。

entry.def: An estate is the same as an estate car .

means.word_mean: 1. everything you own; all of your assets (whether real property or personal property) and liabilities
2. extensive landed property (especially in the country) retained by the owner for his own use;

sentences.sentence: "the family owned a large estate on Long Island"

means.word_mean: 3. a major social class or order of persons regarded collectively as part of the body politic of the country and formerly possessing distinct political rights

auth_sentence.content: Estate taxes are much higher in Britain, too.
auth_sentence.res_content: Estate taxes are much higher in Britain, too.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Estate taxes are much higher in Britain, too.

auth_sentence.content: Real estate held overseas also may become a headache.
auth_sentence.res_content: Real estate held overseas also may become a headache.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Real estate held overseas also may become a headache.

auth_sentence.content: Yet the most visible gains are in real estate.
auth_sentence.res_content: Yet the most visible gains are in real estate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Yet the most visible gains are in real estate.

stems_affixes.word_buile: station位置,岗位+ary……的→adj.静止的,固定的
apo离开+stat站,立+e→n.背教者,变节者

stems_affixes.value_cn: 房地产;不动产;所有权;地位;生活状况
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+stat站,立+e→站出来的东西→房子等不动产
state陈述,说明+ment表名词→n.声明,陈述
stat站,立+ion表名词→立着不动→位置,岗位
stat站,立+istic学科+s→站着[静态]的学科→统计
stat站,立+ure表名词→站着的状态→身高,身材
stat站,立+us→人立于社会的情形→地位,身份

stems_affixes.value_cn: 成文法,法令,法规;章程,规则,条例
stems_affixes.word_buile: stat站,立+ute→站着不能动→法令,法规

Sentence.sentence: She made a wise investment in real estate.
By last year, Wall Street traders, bankers and those who deal in real estate generated 21% of the national income, double their share in the 1950s.

sentences.en: An industrial estate will help to promote the business of that city.
sentences.cn: 工业区将促进那个城市的商业发展。

means.word_mean: (通常指农村的)大片私有土地，庄园

sentences.en: He owns a large estate in Scotland.
sentences.cn: 他在苏格兰有大量地产。

sentences.en: Her estate was divided among her four children.
sentences.cn: 她的遗产分给了她的四个子女。

jushi.english: His estate was divided among his children.
jushi.chinese: 他的遗产分给了他的子女。

jushi.english: I own a large estate in Hong Kong.
He held a lot of real estate and transmitted it to his heirs.
jushi.chinese: 他拥有很多不动产并把它传给他的继承人。
